properties.name: HexagonCityBuilder
properties.description: A tile based city builder example that shows users how to select, deselect, and purchase building types. As well as showing users how to check how many of an instance of an object is in scene, in order to calculate cost and income based on the type of buildings.

objects.name: TutorialText
objects.string:
Left click on icon to select/build
Right click to deselect

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).
description: Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking"
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: HexagonalGrid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Action to snap objects to a virtual hexagonal grid during the game.
description: An action which, when applied on some objects, snap these objects to a *virtual grid*, with cells having customizable width and height.
Useful for level editors or putting objects on a tiled based map (RPG, strategy games, or any tiled based game in general).

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual pointy topped hexagonal grid (this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual pointy topped hexagonal grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToPointyToppedHexagonalGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual pointy topped hexagonal grid using cells with width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

inlineCode: // Find the hexagon cube coordinates for a given position
// The following is a simplified version of this:
// Hexagon cube coordinates to hexagon position
// The following is a simplified version of this:
// const positionX = Math.sqrt(3) * roundX  + Math.sqrt(3)/2 * roundZ;

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.longDescription: The actual row height will be 3/4 of this.
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.longDescription: Odd rows are shifted from half a cell, use a "CellHeight * 3/4" offset to make it the other way.
parameters.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual flat topped hexagonal grid (this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual flat topped hexagonal grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToFlatToppedHexagonalGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual flat topped hexagonal grid using cells with width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment: Note: this is the exact same code as for pointy topped hexagonal grid with x and y swapped.

inlineCode: // Find the hexagon cube coordinates for a given position
// The following is a simplified version of this:
// Hexagon cube coordinates to hexagon position
// The following is a simplified version of this:
// const positionX = Math.sqrt(3) * roundX  + Math.sqrt(3)/2 * roundZ;

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.longDescription: The actual column width will be 3/4 of this.
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.longDescription: Odd columns are shifted from half a cell, use a "CellHeight * 3/4" offset to make it the other way.
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual bubble grid (this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual bubble grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToBubbleGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual bubble grid using cells with width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment:
This grid is like bottles stacking, odd lines are shifted from half a cell. 

On an hexagonal grid a line height is 3/4 of sprite height but with bubbles it is sin(60) that is around 0.866 which is near 7/8 = 0.875
(7/6)/(3/4) = 7/6
Using this ratio, the cellHeigt gives the 7/8 line height and this allows integer position as assets are often a multiple of 8.

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.longDescription: The actual row height will be 7/8 of this.
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.longDescription: Odd rows are shifted from half a cell, use a "CellHeight * 7/8" offset to make it the other way
parameters.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: We don't use the touch capability condition because the device could have both touch and cursor.
The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

Ignore mouse events when a touch is active because the mouse is probably an echo of touch events.
The mouse press could be a touch that has not the right TouchId.
The trigger once must be before the state condition to detect a new press.

Ignore mouse events when a touch is active because the mouse is probably an echo of touch events.
The mouse release could be a touch release that has not the right TouchId.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

events.comment: Using a function avoid the OR to unselect Object when the property is not set.

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the text of the button label.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.
eventsFunctions.name: LabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterWithPaddingY

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel
